response:
## Figure and Formula Quiz for "Separable Representations of Higher-Rank Graphs"

This quiz focuses on the figure on page 7 of the scientific article and the associated Equation (1) which defines Λ<sup>n</sup>.

**Question 1:**

The figure on page 7 of the article depicts a:

(A) 1-graph  
(B) 2-graph  
(C) 3-graph  
(D) It is impossible to determine from the figure alone.

**Answer:** (A) 1-graph

**Question 2:**

According to Equation (1), for a given k-graph Λ and n ∈ N<sup>k</sup>, what does Λ<sup>n</sup> represent?

(A) The set of all morphisms (paths) in Λ.  
(B) The set of objects (vertices) in Λ.  
(C) The set of morphisms (paths) in Λ with degree n.  
(D) The set of identity morphisms in Λ with degree n.

**Answer:** (C) The set of morphisms (paths) in Λ with degree n.

**Question 3:**

In the context of 1-graphs, what does the degree of a morphism (path) correspond to?

(A) The number of vertices in the path.  
(B) The number of edges in the path.  
(C) The starting vertex of the path.  
(D) The ending vertex of the path.

**Answer:** (B) The number of edges in the path.

**Question 4:**

In the figure on page 7, what does the notation "v<sub>1</sub>Λv<sub>2</sub>" represent?

(A) All paths starting at v<sub>1</sub> and ending at v<sub>2</sub>.  
(B) All paths with degree 1.  
(C) The set of vertices {v<sub>1</sub>, v<sub>2</sub>}.  
(D) The empty set, as there are no paths directly from v<sub>1</sub> to v<sub>2</sub>.

**Answer:** (A) All paths starting at v<sub>1</sub> and ending at v<sub>2</sub>.
